column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
column14: I’m so impressed with the efficacy of this product! I’ve developed these eczema types patches on my arms that would get aggravated after shower and for a long time, I suspected it was the body wash I was using. Through research, I learned about how most body washes have a very high pH causing skin issues. I decided to test this out and it didn’t disappoint even though I already had high expectations  based on great reviews. I saw some reviews claimed it didn’t smell very good. I don’t think it’s repulsive or anything. I also didn’t exactly expect it to smell like Jo Malone. It’s a light, pleasant smell that pretty much goes away shortly after drying off.

column6: Not for oily, acne prone skin
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
column14: I have oily, acne prone, sensitive skin and get migraines. While I actually find the scent pleasant, it gives me nausea and a migraine aura. Also, it doesn’t seem to wash well off my skin and causes breakouts. I would recommend this to those with dry skin and who aren’t sensitive to fragrances. I’m surprised something made for sensitive skin would have dyes and fragrance.
